content:
Diagnosis:
Desmoplastic infantile ganglioglioma (WHO grade I)
BRAF wildtype
Right temporal lobe lesion diagnosed March 2024

Previous medical history:
Febrile seizures age 2
No other significant history

Current medications:
Levetiracetam 250mg twice daily

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Post-operative following gross total resection on 15 April 2024

I reviewed [redacted name] today accompanied by both parents following recent neurosurgery. The 4-year-old has made an excellent recovery from surgery with no neurological deficits. The post-operative MRI shows complete resection of the right temporal lesion with expected post-surgical changes. Histology confirms WHO grade I desmoplastic infantile ganglioglioma, BRAF wildtype status.

She is tolerating the anti-epileptic medication well with no further seizures since surgery. Her speech, mobility, and behavior are all age-appropriate. Parents report good appetite and normal sleep pattern.

Given the complete resection and favorable histology, we will proceed with surveillance only. I have arranged an MRI brain in 3 months' time. We will see her back in clinic following this scan. The family understands to contact us sooner if there are any concerns.

cancer_timeline.value: Post-operative MRI shows complete resection with expected post-surgical changes
Histology confirms WHO grade I desmoplastic infantile ganglioglioma, BRAF wildtype

status_updates.value: WHO grade I desmoplastic infantile ganglioglioma with complete surgical resection. Excellent post-operative recovery with no neurological deficits
Complete surgical resection achieved with no residual disease on post-operative imaging
